newsitem.title: TURKEY: Merger creates Turkey's biggest cement group.
newsitem.headline: Merger creates Turkey's biggest cement group.

text.p: The merger of two big cement producers -- Canakkale Cimento Sanayii A.S. of Cementeries CBR SA/Belgium, and Akcimento Ticaret A.S. of Sabanci Group -- will create Turkey's biggest group in the sector.

Akcansa, the name given to the new company which will be formally formed after Canakkale's extraordinary annual meeting on Friday, will have two plants with a total production capacity of 3.78 million tonnes.
"The merger is a big step towards the consolidation of the Turkish cement industry," Emir Adiguzel, deputy general manager of Canakkale Cimento, told Reuters in an interview.
The merger makes the group of Cementeries CBR SA/Belgium and the Sabanci Group Turkey's biggest cement producer with a total production capacity of 5.982 million tonnes of cement.
Total sales of the two companies in the first seven months of 1996 were 2.698 million tonnes, including 814,000 tonnes of exports.

Other major cement producer groups in Turkey are the Rumeli Group with a capacity of 4.09 million tonnes, Oyak 3.67 million tonnes, Lafarge-Coppe of France 3.18 million tonnes, SET of France 2.62 million tonnes, Bati Anadolu 1.84 million tonnes and Vicat Cementeries of France 1.33 million tonnes.
Akcimsa and the six companies control 75 percent of Turkey's total production.
"The merger operation will be under the umberella of Canakkale Cimento," Adiguzel said.
The president of the company is expected to be choosen from Sabanci Group and the vice president from the CBR Group.

"The Canakkale plant will be the export gate of the company, which has its own port with a 10,000 tonnes loading capacity per day," Adiguzel said. "The plant has a warehouse with 82,000 tonnes storage capacity and bulkers with a maximum capacity of 82,000 DWT can be loaded at its port."
Canakkale Cimento has a share of about 30 percent in Turkey's total cement exports of 2.156 million tonnes in the first seven months of 1996.

"On the other hand, Akcimento is very active in the regional market, the Thrace and Istanbul regions with a very effective chain of dealers," Adiguzel said, "Akcimento will be our locomotive in the domestic market."
Akcimento sold 964,788 tonnes of its total sales of 1,097,116 tonnes to the domestic market and exported 132,328 tonnes in the first seven months.
Canakkale Cimento reported 3.60 trillion lira net sales in the first half, up from 2.11 trillion in the same period of 1995.
The company reported a loss of 307 billion lira in the first six months of this year against a 13.9 billion profit in the same 1995 period.
Akcimento reported 2.97 trillion lira net sales in the first half, up from 1.85 trillion last year. The company's net profit soared to 801 billion lira from 78 billion.
